channel.title: Qubes-Whonix upgrade not possible
channel.description:
Hello everyone.
Attention, as this is my first post on the forum, the system wanted me to delete all the links and all the images...
I just installed Qubes on my machine.
I launched the update manager (the little star on the top right). All the updates have been done, except for whonix-ws.
iiiii iiiii
I read (too late) this article where it is specified that you should not use the "Qube manager" to update whonix... LLLLL
So I tried in command line, by going in the applications
Model : whonix-gw-15 : terminal Xfce Model : whonix-ws-15 : terminal Xfce
whonix-gw has been updated but not whonix ws : iiiii
Qubes 4.0.4 contains Whonix 15 ... but this page : LLLLL proves that you can install a stable version 16 of Whonix in Qubes 4.0.4.
I did the following test: sudo cat /srv/formulas/base/virtual-machines-formula/qvm/whonix.jinja ...the terminal showed me version 15.
Then I tried another method: I opened the dom0 terminal and executed the following line: sudo qubes-dom0-update --enablerepo=qubes-templates-community qubes-template-whonix-gw-16 qubes-template-whonix-ws-16
... as shown in this document : LLLLL
It doesn't work and the download restarts every time. As you can see in the screenshots below, this would be an expired certificate issue: iiiii
iiiii
Currently, I really don't know what to do...
I must specify that I am a beginner in learning under Linux...

item.title: Qubes-Whonix upgrade not possible
item.dc:creator: Artus
item.description:
I understand. Thank you for your answer.

I preferred to reinstall everything normally, because I will use Qubes for my work.

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes-Whonix upgrade not possible
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Welcome to Whonix forums and thank you for your question!

You can post links now.

Artus:

I did the following test:
sudo cat /srv/formulas/base/virtual-machines-formula/qvm/whonix.jinja
…the terminal showed me version 15.

Root cause. You cannot proceed until this is fixed.
dom0 update required. This is mentioned in Qubes-Whonix installation documentation.
If dom0 update won’t update this file then that’s a Qubes, not a Whonix issue. → What to post in this Qubes-Whonix forum and what not.

Artus:

expired certificate issue

qubes-dom0-update certificate issue → Qubes issue → What to post in this Qubes-Whonix forum and what not.

awokd:

might want to
redo it with Qubes 4.1rc1 (Download Qubes OS | Qubes OS ) since it
includes Whonix 16 GW & WS.

Note:

github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues

Qubes-Whonix 16 for Qubes R4.1

opened 05:06PM - 10 Sep 21 UTC
adrelanos
T: enhancement C: Whonix P: default

Maintainer for Qubes-Whonix here. Qubes-Whonix `16` for Qubes `R4.1` is not y…et supported by me. (And Qubes-Whonix `15` won't ever be since Qubes-Whonix `16` release for Qubes `R4.0` is very close. -> https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/6891) Some discussion here: * https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/6597#issuecomment-839799243 * https://github.com/QubesOS/qubes-issues/issues/6597#issuecomment-839923299 No rush, however please let me know when a Qubes `R4.1` signed ISO installer release (alpha, beta, stable) become available or any estimated release dates. Once that's done I need to sort out my personal Qubes hardware support issues. I might update this post later. This ticket can be a placeholder, a general ticket usable as link to explain the current status to users, used for discussion... Related: * #6597 * #6891

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes-Whonix upgrade not possible
item.dc:creator: awokd
item.description:
Then I tried another method: I opened the dom0 terminal and executed the following line:
sudo qubes-dom0-update --enablerepo=qubes-templates-community qubes-template-whonix-gw-16 qubes-template-whonix-ws-16

It doesn’t work and the download restarts every time. As you can see in the screenshots below, this would be an expired certificate issue:

This is more of a Qubes issue, as they host the templates for download.
However, since it sounds like you are doing a new install, might want to
redo it with Qubes 4.1rc1 (Download Qubes OS | Qubes OS) since it
includes Whonix 16 GW & WS.

Read full topic
